benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId} - Retrieve an account by id

covered: Valid requests and main success cases covered (default and parameterized retrievals returning 200) — TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC27-TC33, TC30.
Path parameter validation and error handling: malformed UUID -> 400, non-existent -> 404, no-accounts -> 404 — TC09, TC08, TC07.

Query parameter permutations and validation: audit levels NONE/FULL/MINIMAL, boolean combinations, partial-empty boolean case and invalid audit value handling — TC04, TC05, TC24, TC23, TC25, TC27-TC33.
Authorization negative cases for missing/invalid credentials (401) — TC10, TC11.
Security hardening tests for injection and XSS payloads in accountId — TC13, TC14.
Resilience and error scenarios: service unavailable (503), transient network retry and recovery, timeout behavior and large payload handling and concurrency — TC12, TC26, TC16, TC17, TC18.
Extra parameter handling and backward-compatibility/accessibility checks: unknown params ignored, older client headers and API docs accessibility — TC15, TC19, TC21.
Regression test for previously fixed bug (accountWithBalance ignored) is present — TC22.
gaps: Caching behavior and conditional GETs are not tested: no assertions for ETag, If-None-Match, Cache-Control or 304 responses.
Rate limiting and throttling are not covered (no tests for 429 Too Many Requests or Retry-After headers).
Authorization scope/permission checks producing 403 Forbidden are not tested (only 401 missing/invalid token cases exist).
Explicit response media type and headers are not asserted — tests do not check Content-Type: application/json or Accept negotiation.
Strict schema validation of the Account JSON object (required fields, types, formats) is not present; "contains Account object" is asserted but not validated against a schema.
Server 500/Internal Server Error simulations (e.g., DB failure) are not present; only 503 is tested.
Invalid non-boolean values for boolean flags (e.g., accountWithBalance=abc, accountWithBalance=1) are not explicitly tested beyond empty value case (TC23).
Edge cases for balances/CBA (zero, negative, extremely large amounts, precision) are not covered — only positive-balance scenarios are referenced.

Pagination is not covered. For a single-resource endpoint this may be N/A, but if the Account payload includes nested collections (transactions) pagination or streaming should be clarified and tested.
Concurrency tests cover concurrent reads but do not cover read-while-write consistency or conflict scenarios.
recommendations: Add explicit assertions for response headers: Content-Type must be application/json and verify Accept header negotiation.
Validate responses against the Account JSON schema (required fields, types, UUID format for id, numeric formats and precision for balance/CBA).
Add caching tests: assert presence/semantics of ETag and Cache-Control, perform conditional GETs with If-None-Match and expect 304 when unchanged.
Add rate-limiting tests that trigger 429 Too Many Requests and validate Retry-After or related headers and behavior.
Add authorization scope/permission tests that exercise 403 Forbidden (valid token with insufficient privileges).
Simulate server-side failures to assert 500 Internal Server Error handling, logging and any compensating behavior.
Add tests for malformed/non-boolean query values (accountWithBalance=abc, accountWithBalance=1) and ensure proper 400 responses and error messages.
Add balance/CBA edge-case tests (zero, negative, very large values) to validate numeric handling and precision.
Clarify whether nested lists (transactions) inside Account are paginated; if so add pagination tests for those sub-resources and test large nested payload handling.
Extend concurrency tests to include read-while-write scenarios and verify data consistency under concurrent modifications.
Add conditional caching lifecycle tests (If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since), and test clients respecting 304 responses to reduce payload.
Document and add tests for expected precedence when boolean flags conflict (explicitly assert which flag wins) and ensure behavior matches API contract.
